skill.name: infrastructure-reporting
skill.description: Generate comprehensive network infrastructure reports including health status, performance analysis, security audits, and capacity planning recommendations.
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive network infrastructure reports including health status, performance analysis,...
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only a SKILL.md markdown file. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities exist in this skill. The skill describes a set of MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools for network infrastructure reporting.

content.value_statement: Network administrators spend hours manually compiling health, performance, and security reports across multiple sites. This skill automates comprehensive infrastructure reporting by gathering data from network tools and producing executive summaries with actionable recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Generate network health and status reports across all sites
Create performance analysis reports with device and client metrics
Produce security audit and compliance documentation
Build device inventory reports with hardware details
Develop capacity planning recommendations with upgrade timelines
Compare metrics and performance across multiple sites
limitations: Requires access to UniFi network MCP tools to function
Cannot access network devices directly without MCP tool integration
Reports depend on data quality from connected network infrastructure
Cannot modify network configurations or settings

use_cases.title: Weekly Health Monitoring
use_cases.description: Generate weekly health check reports across all sites to identify issues before they become outages.

use_cases.title: Executive Reporting
use_cases.description: Create executive dashboards summarizing network performance and security posture for stakeholder meetings.

use_cases.title: Security Audits
use_cases.description: Document network security posture with firewall rules and access control reviews for compliance requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly Health Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a weekly health report for all sites. Include device status, client connections, and any alerts or issues.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a monthly performance report. Analyze device utilization, client bandwidth usage, and identify slow spots.

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a security audit report covering firewall zones, ACL rules, and network segmentation compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Capacity Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform capacity planning analysis. Review current device utilization, predict growth needs, and recommend upgrades.

output: Network Health Summary: All 3 sites operating normally
Device Status: 47 devices online, 2 offline (awaiting replacement)
Client Connections: 234 active clients across network
WiFi Performance: Average signal strength -72 dBm, channel interference detected on Site 2
Alerts: 3 unauthorized device attempts blocked by firewall

best_practices: Run health reports weekly to establish baseline metrics and detect anomalies early
Use security audit reports before compliance reviews to identify and address gaps
Combine performance and capacity reports when planning infrastructure upgrades
anti_patterns: Do not rely on reports for real-time incident response without verifying current data
Do not ignore recommendations that span multiple reporting periods without investigation
Do not share sensitive network details from reports without proper access controls

faq.question: What UniFi network tools are required?
faq.answer: This skill works with the UniFi Network MCP tools including get_site_health, get_network_devices, and related endpoints.

faq.question: How many sites can the report cover?
faq.answer: Reports can cover all sites configured in your UniFi controller. Performance may vary with very large deployments.

faq.question: Can I export reports to PDF or other formats?
faq.answer: The skill generates formatted text and markdown suitable for export or integration with documentation systems.

faq.question: Is my network data sent externally?
faq.answer: No external data transmission occurs. All data remains within your network infrastructure and AI environment.

faq.question: Why do some reports show incomplete data?
faq.answer: Report completeness depends on data collected by your UniFi controller. Offline devices or limited monitoring may affect results.

faq.question: How does this compare to UniFi Network UI reports?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-generated summaries with recommendations beyond the standard UniFi dashboard views.
